meanings.definition: To revive or renew (a feeling or relationship)
meanings.sent1: After their argument, they decided to rekindle their friendship.
meanings.sent2: They wanted to rekindle the joy they used to feel when playing together.
meanings.sent3: The movie about friendship made them want to rekindle their own bond.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had the power to rekindle his hope in humanity.
meanings.sent5: The old photograph helped rekindle memories of their childhood adventures.

meanings.definition: To ignite or light (a fire) again
meanings.sent1: He used the match to rekindle the dying campfire.
meanings.sent2: The camper needed to rekindle the fire to keep warm.
meanings.sent3: Trying to rekindle the fire with wet wood was a challenge.
meanings.sent4: The sparks from the flint helped rekindle the extinguished flames.
meanings.sent5: The gust of wind unexpectedly rekindled the embers, lighting up the night.
